reward.name: Adaptable Artillery
entries: {@i Prerequisite: {@table Level 7 Gift Rewards|WM4|Level 7 Reward}}
You can treat every ranged weapon as if it were a Simple melee weapon of your choice.
{@note Made by Landon}

reward.name: Assassin's Mark
entries: {@i Prerequisite: {@table Level 7 Gift Rewards|WM4|Level 7 Reward}, Hunter's Mark}
If you hit a creature marked by your Hunter's Mark with a weapon attack, you can choose to end the Hunter's Mark on the creature. If you do so, your attack deals an extra {@dice 4d6} damage.
If you have Foe Slayer, this instead becomes {@dice 4d10} damage.
{@note Made by Aris}

reward.name: Brutal Thrower
entries: {@i Prerequisite: {@table Level 7 Gift Rewards|WM4|Level 7 Reward}}
You treat every melee weapon as if it has the thrown property with a range of (20/60). After you make an attack, the weapon magically returns to your hand.
{@note Made by Chrys}

reward.name: Bulwark
entries: {@i Prerequisite: {@table Level 7 Gift Rewards|WM4|Level 7 Reward}, Unarmored Defense}
You add your Strength Modifier to your Unarmored Defense calculations.
{@note Made by V}

reward.name: Close Quarters Defense
entries: {@i Prerequisite: {@table Level 7 Gift Rewards|WM4|Level 7 Reward}}

When a creature within 5 feet of you attempts to {@condition Grappled|XPHB|Grapple} you or subject you to an effect that would {@condition Grappled|XPHB|Grapple} you, you can use your reaction to make a melee weapon attack against that creature. If you hit, you deal {@dice 1d6} extra damage, and you automatically succeed against the effect.
{@note Made by Chrys}

reward.name: Cram Study
entries: {@i Prerequisite: {@table Level 7 Gift Rewards|WM4|Level 7 Reward}}

When you finish a Long Rest, you can choose {@skill Arcana}, {@skill History}, {@skill Investigation}, {@skill Nature}, or {@skill Religion}. If you do not have Proficiency in that Skill, you gain Proficiency with that skill until the end of your next long rest. If you did have Proficiency, when you take the {@action study|XPHB|Study Action}, you have Advantage on Intelligence checks involving that Skill.
{@note Made by Landon}

reward.name: Dirty Tactics
entries: {@i Prerequisite: {@table Level 7 Gift Rewards|WM4|Level 7 Reward}}

As a Bonus Action, you can throw irritating particles at a creature within 10 feet of you. It must make a Dexterity Saving throw, or become {@condition Blinded} until the end of your turn. The saving throw is equal to 8 + Your Proficiency Modifier + Your Dexterity modifier.
Additionally, you have a +1 bonus to weapon damage rolls against {@condition Prone} creatures.
{@note Made by Landon}

reward.name: Dungeon Adept
entries: {@i Prerequisite: {@table Level 7 Gift Rewards|WM4|Level 7 Reward}}
You have advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) and Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) checks made to detect the presence of secret doors.
You have advantage on saving throws made to avoid or resist traps.
You have resistance to the damage dealt by traps.
{@note Made by Landon}

reward.name: Eldritch Akimbo
entries: {@i Prerequisite: {@table Level 7 Gift Rewards|WM4|Level 7 Reward}, Pact of the Blade Invocation}
Your Pact of the Blade invocation can sustain two weapons at the same time, allowing you to keep up the pressure with dual-wielded weapons.
{@note Made by Lily}

reward.name: Empowered Turning
entries: {@i Prerequisite: {@table Level 7 Gift Rewards|WM4|Level 7 Reward}, Channel Divinity (Turn Undead)}
The range of your Turn Undead is increased to 60 feet, and undead within 15 feet of you have disadvantage on the saving throw.
{@note Made by Chrys}

reward.name: Enduring Focus
entries: {@i Prerequisite: {@table Level 7 Gift Rewards|WM4|Level 7 Reward}, Flurry of Blows}
The first time you use Flurry of Blows after a short or long rest, you can do so without expending focus points. Additionally, you gain 2 more focus points to your total pool.
{@note Made by Chrys}

reward.name: Expanded Cunning Strikes
entries: {@i Prerequisite: {@table Level 7 Gift Rewards|WM4|Level 7 Reward}, Cunning Strike}
You have the following options added to your Cunning Strike feature:

entries.name: Lacerate (cost 1d6).
entries: The target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or suffer {@dice 3d6} Piercing damage at the start of its next turn.

entries.name: Hamstring (cost 2d6).
entries: The target must succeed on a Strength saving throw or have its speed reduced by 15 feet.
{@note Made by Chrys}

reward.name: Familiar Familiarity
entries: {@i Prerequisite: {@table Level 7 Gift Rewards|WM4|Level 7 Reward}}
You always have the {@spell Find Familiar|XPHB} spell prepared. Additionally, you can cast it without expending a spell slot, but you cannot do so again until you finish a long rest.
{@note Made by Landon}

reward.name: Fast Reader
entries: {@i Prerequisite: {@table Level 7 Gift Rewards|WM4|Level 7 Reward}, {@class Wizard}}
You can read twice as quickly as most people, and it takes you only half the time to copy spells into your book.
{@note Made by Lily}

reward.name: Hotswapper
entries: {@i Prerequisite: {@table Level 7 Gift Rewards|WM4|Level 7 Reward}}
Whenever you roll initiative, you may immediately draw a weapon, and the first attack roll you make that combat has advantage. Additionally, you can don or doff a shield as an object interaction.
{@note Made by Lily}

reward.name: Malleable Illusions
entries: {@i Prerequisite: {@table Level 7 Gift Rewards|WM4|Level 7 Reward}, Spellcasting}

When you cast an illusion spell that has a duration of 1 minute or longer, you can use a Magic Action to change the nature of that illusion (using the spell's normal parameters for the illusion), provided that you can see the illusion.
{@note Made by Gavin}

reward.name: Polyglot
entries: {@i Prerequisite: {@table Level 7 Gift Rewards|WM4|Level 7 Reward}}
Whenever you finish a short or long rest, you can choose a Language to know until you finish another short or long rest.
{@note Made by Landon}

reward.name: Powerful Shove
entries: {@i Prerequisite: {@table Level 7 Gift Rewards|WM4|Level 7 Reward}}
Whenever a creature fails the saving throw against being Shoved by you, you can have it take bludgeoning damage equal to your strength modifier.
{@note Made by Landon}

reward.name: Sparks of Magic
entries: {@i Prerequisite: {@table Level 7 Gift Rewards|WM4|Level 7 Reward}}

You always have {@spell Dancing Lights}, {@spell Elementalism|XPHB}, {@spell Mending}, {@spell Prestidigitation}, and {@spell Thaumaturgy} prepared. Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for this feat's spells (choose when you select this Gift).
{@note Made by Landon}

reward.name: Tactical Opportunist
entries: {@i Prerequisite: {@table Level 7 Gift Rewards|WM4|Level 7 Reward}}

Whenever you make an {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB|Attack Of Opportunity} against a creature, you can choose to roll at advantage. If you land this attack, all allies within 15 feet of the creature gain a +1 bonus to their attack and damage rolls against the creature until the start of the creature's next turn.
You can use this ability a number of times equal to half of your Proficiency Bonus (rounded down), and regain expended uses at the end of a short or long rest.
{@note Made by Chrys}

reward.name: Vexing Mark
entries: {@i Prerequisite: {@table Level 7 Gift Rewards|WM4|Level 7 Reward}, Hunter's Mark}
Creatures affected by your Hunter's Mark subtract {@dice 1d4} from their saving throws against your spells.
{@note Made by Chrys}

reward.name: Horde Slayer
entries: {@i Prerequisite: {@table Level 16 Gift Rewards|WM4|Level 16 Reward}}

When an attack you make reduces a creature to 0 hit points, you can target another creature within range and, if the original attack roll can hit it, applies any remaining damage to it. If that creature is likewise reduced to 0 hit points, repeat this process, carrying over the remaining damage until there are no valid targets, or until the damage carried over fails to reduce a creature to 0 hit points.
{@note Made by Landon}

reward.name: Master of All Weapons
entries: {@i Prerequisite: {@table Level 16 Gift Rewards|WM4|Level 16 Reward}, Fighter}
You have mastery in all weapons.

entries.name: A Little Bit of Everything.
entries: You may unequip and equip a weapon after each attack when you take the Attack Action on your turn. Once per turn, when you do this, you may attack an additional time if the weapon you equipped has a different mastery property than the one you unequipped.
{@note Made by Gavin}

reward.name: Positional Master
entries: {@i Prerequisite: {@table Level 16 Gift Rewards|WM4|Level 16 Reward}}
Immediately after you roll Initiative, you can take a Reaction to cast {@spell Scatter|XGE} without expending a spell slot.
{@note Made by Landon}

reward.name: Positive Energy Flux
entries: {@i Prerequisite: {@table Level 16 Gift Rewards|WM4|Level 16 Reward}; Bard, Cleric or Druid}

When you restore Hit Points to a creature with a spell, any excess healing (Hit Points not healed due to being at maximum health), the target instead receives a number of Temporary Hit Points equal to the excess healing. These Temporary Hit Points cannot exceed the target's maximum Hit Points.
These Temporary Hit Points remain for 1 minute.
{@note Made by Chrys}

reward.name: Planar Voyager
entries: {@i Prerequisite: {@table Level 16 Gift Rewards|WM4|Level 16 Reward}}

You always have the {@spell Plane Shift} spell prepared. When you cast it, it doesn’t require components. Additionally, you can cast it without expending a spell slot, but you cannot do so again until you finish a long rest.
Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for this gift (choose when you receive it).
{@note Made by Aris}

reward.name: Let’s Get This Out Onto A Tray
entries: You never tire of eating rations and have Advantage on Saving Throws against the Poisoned condition from consuming spoiled or old rations. Nice.
{@note Made by Chrys}

reward.name: Specific Knowledge: [Topic]
entries: You gain a +5 bonus to ability checks you make about that topic. The checks must only apply if it makes sense to apply to the topic. This bonus does not stack when using a Book.
{@note Original by Aris, Reworked by Landon}

reward.name: Spellheart
entries: {@i Prerequisite: Spellcasting feature}
If you have no spell slots remaining for an entire minute, you regain a 1st level spell slot.
Sorcerers cannot convert slots regained in this way into sorcery points. These slots cannot be used to refuel uses of other features, such as Wild Resurgence or Font of Inspiration.
{@note Made by Aris}

reward.name: Gorg is this real?
entries: When you take the {@action Study|XPHB} action, you can ask Gorg for help. He responds if he happens to be within earshot.
{@note Made by Landon}

reward.name: Gork is this real?
entries: When you take the {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can ask Gork for help. He responds if he happens to be within earshot.
{@note Made by Gem}

reward.name: Juggling Training
entries: {@i Prerequisite: Proficiency in {@skill Sleight of Hand} or {@skill Performance}}

You can juggle a number of {@item Juggling Club|WM4|Juggling Clubs} or other small objects in one hand without needing to make an ability check. You can make weapon attacks using any of the {@item Juggling Club|WM4|Juggling Clubs} you are juggling. If you hit an attack with a {@item Juggling Club|WM4|juggling club} you were juggling, it returns to your hand.
{@note Made by Gem}

reward.name: Street Juggler
entries: {@i Prerequisite: {@reward Juggling Training|WM4}}
You can use any object or item that weighs less than 1 lb as a {@item Juggling Club|WM4}.
{@note Made by Gem}

reward.name: Attunement Adept
entries: {@i Prerequisite: {@table Level 7 Gift Rewards|WM4|Level 7 Reward}}
You can attune to an additional magic item.
{@note Made by Gem}

reward.name: Attunement Expert
entries: {@i Prerequisite: {@table Level 16 Gift Rewards|WM4|Level 16 Reward}}
You can attune to an additional magic item. It only takes you 1 minute to end your attunement to an item.
You can use a {@action Magic|XPHB} Action to touch a magic item and immediately attune to it. Once you do so, you can't again until you finish a long rest.
{@note Made by Gem}

reward.name: Birthday Blessing!
entries: While it is your birthday (the PC's birthday), you add {@dice 1d4} to D20 Tests.
{@note Made by Landon}

reward.name: Looks at camera...
entries: You always know what direction to look at the camera.
{@note Made by Aris}

reward.name: Sloppy Style
entries: When you make a Wisdom ({@item Cook's Utensils|XPHB}) check in order to prepare food, you can choose to roll a 1 on the die. When you do so the food becomes inedible, providing no nutrition.
{@note Made by Gem}

reward.name: Unleashing... My True... Power....!!!
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can tense up, as a 10 foot Emanation amasses around you. You choose its appearance. This emanation remains until the end of your next turn.
{@note Made by Aris}

reward.name: Death Burst
entries: You explode when you die. Each creature within a 5-foot emanation of you must succeed on a DC 10 Constitution saving throw or suffer {@dice 2d4} damage. The damage type is determined when you receive this talent.
Additionally: At gm's discretion, you also explode in extremely awkward social situations.
{@note Made by Xin}

reward.name: Fish Wrangler
entries: {@i Prerequisite: Monk}

You may wield a creature grappled by you as an improvised weapon as long as they are at least 1 size category smaller than you. If the creature has a swim speed, it instead counts as a monk weapon for you.
{@note Made by Xin}

reward.name: Ley Line Initiate
entries: {@note Exotic: An item that is not necessarily magical, but is difficult to acquire and can only be purchased under certain circumstances.}

In places of great magic, you can attune to the environment to draw upon it's power. When you finish a long rest in an area, you can attune to it as if it were a magic item until you finish another long rest. This fails if the area is not particularly full of magic.

When you attune to an area, you gain a Charm befitting to the area. This Charm goes away if you unattune to the area. The GM decides which Charm you receive. A GM could say that you are affected by the environment in a different way.
The default Charms are as follows:
Ley Lines and the energy that flows through them can be fickle, ever-shifting, and unpredictable, so your results may vary. (AKA: GM Discretion)
{@note Made by Landon}

reward.name: Plug the Leaks!
entries: Whenever you would make a check to repair a ship, you gain a +5 bonus to said check, with the assumption that the repairs you make are only intended to last a short while, and aren't sustainable in the long term.
You may use {@item Carpenter's Tools|XPHB} to attempt to repair a sailing vessel, so long as said sailing vessel is at a quarter of its maximum hitpoints or lower, as if you were proficient.
{@note Made by Patrick}

reward.name: Sign of the Kraken
entries: {@i Prerequisite: Born on the 1st Month, Hammer}
A creature can attune to their birthstone, treating a gem worth at least 50 gp as an item requiring attunement to gain the benefits of, though it is not magical.

entries.name: Optimal Career.
entries: You have a +2 bonus on Strength ({@skill Athletics}) checks to swim.

entries.name: Lucky Action.
entries: You have a +1 bonus to Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks.

entries.name: Birthstone.
entries: You can attune to an {@item Aquamarine|XDMG}. If you do, you gain a +1 AC bonus against melee attacks.
{@note {@table Astrological Signs|WM4}, Made by Landon}

reward.name: Sign of the Basilisk
entries: {@i Prerequisite: Born on the 2nd Month, Alturiak}
A creature can attune to their birthstone, treating a gem worth at least 50 gp as an item requiring attunement to gain the benefits of, though it is not magical.

entries.name: Optimal Career.
entries: You have a +2 bonus on Charisma ({@skill Intimidation}) checks.

entries.name: Lucky Action.
entries: You have a +1 bonus to Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) checks.

entries.name: Birthstone.
entries: You can attune to a {@item Ruby|XDMG}. If you do, you gain a +2 bonus to saving throws against transmutation magic.
{@note {@table Astrological Signs|WM4}, Made by Landon}

reward.name: Sign of the Beholder
entries: {@i Prerequisite: Born on the 3rd Month, Ches}
A creature can attune to their birthstone, treating a gem worth at least 50 gp as an item requiring attunement to gain the benefits of, though it is not magical.

entries.name: Optimal Career.
entries: You have a +2 bonus on Intelligence checks to decipher codes.

entries.name: Lucky Action.
entries: You have a +1 bonus to Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks.

entries.name: Birthstone.
entries: You can attune to an {@item Banded Agate|XDMG|Agate}. If you do, it grants you a +2 bonus to saving throws against illusion magic.
{@note {@table Astrological Signs|WM4}, Made by Landon}

reward.name: Sign of the Harpy
entries: {@i Prerequisite: Born on the 4th Month, Tarsakh}
A creature can attune to their birthstone, treating a gem worth at least 50 gp as an item requiring attunement to gain the benefits of, though it is not magical.

entries.name: Optimal Career.
entries: You have a +2 bonus on Charisma ({@skill Performance}) checks that use your voice.

entries.name: Lucky Action.
entries: You have a +1 bonus to Charisma ({@skill Deception}) checks.

entries.name: Birthstone.
entries: You can attune to a {@item Turquoise|XDMG}. If you do, it grants you a +1 AC bonus against Ranged attacks.
{@note {@table Astrological Signs|WM4}, Made by Landon}

reward.name: Sign of the Ettin
entries: {@i Prerequisite: Born on the 5th Month, Mirtul}
A creature can attune to their birthstone, treating a gem worth at least 50 gp as an item requiring attunement to gain the benefits of, though it is not magical.

entries.name: Optimal Career.
entries: You have a +2 bonus on Dexterity ({@skill Sleight of Hand}) checks during combat.

entries.name: Lucky Action.
entries: You have a +1 bonus to Dexterity ({@item Thieves' Tools|XPHB}) checks to disable devices.

entries.name: Birthstone.
entries: You can attune to an {@item Opal|XDMG}. If you do, it grants you a +1 AC bonus against Attacks of Opportunity.
{@note {@table Astrological Signs|WM4}, Made by Landon}

reward.name: Sign of the Dryad
entries: {@i Prerequisite: Born on the 6th Month, Kythorn}
A creature can attune to their birthstone, treating a gem worth at least 50 gp as an item requiring attunement to gain the benefits of, though it is not magical.

entries.name: Optimal Career.
entries: You have a +2 bonus on Wisdom ({@skill Animal Handling}) checks.

entries.name: Lucky Action.
entries: You have a +1 bonus to Wisdom ({@skill Medicine}) checks.

entries.name: Birthstone.
entries: You can attune to a {@item Pearl|XDMG}. If you do, it grants you a +1 AC bonus when there's a friendly creature within 5 feet of you.
{@note {@table Astrological Signs|WM4}, Made by Landon}

reward.name: Sign of the Stirge
entries: {@i Prerequisite: Born on the 7th Month, Flamerule}
A creature can attune to their birthstone, treating a gem worth at least 50 gp as an item requiring attunement to gain the benefits of, though it is not magical.

entries.name: Optimal Career.
entries: You have a +2 bonus on Intelligence ({@item Alchemist's Supplies|XPHB|Alchemy Tools}) checks.

entries.name: Lucky Action.
entries: You have a +1 bonus to Constitution saving throws to maintain concentration.

entries.name: Birthstone.
entries: You can attune to an {@item Emerald|XDMG}. If you do, it grants you a +2 bonus to saving throws against enchantment magic.
{@note {@table Astrological Signs|WM4}, Made by Landon}

reward.name: Sign of the Wyvern
entries: {@i Prerequisite: Born on the 8th Month, Eleasis}
A creature can attune to their birthstone, treating a gem worth at least 50 gp as an item requiring attunement to gain the benefits of, though it is not magical.

entries.name: Optimal Career.
entries: You have a +2 bonus on Wisdom ({@skill Survival}) checks to forage.

entries.name: Lucky Action.
entries: You have a +1 bonus to Dexterity Saving throws to remain mounted.

entries.name: Birthstone.
entries: You can attune to a {@item Blue Sapphire|XDMG|Sapphire}. If you do, it grants you a +1 AC bonus during a turn where you've moved more than 5 feet.
{@note {@table Astrological Signs|WM4}, Made by Landon}

reward.name: Sign of the Dragon
entries: {@i Prerequisite: Born on the 9th Month, Eleint}
A creature can attune to their birthstone, treating a gem worth at least 50 gp as an item requiring attunement to gain the benefits of, though it is not magical.

entries.name: Optimal Career.
entries: You have a +2 bonus on Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) checks to appraise the value of objects.

entries.name: Lucky Action.
entries: You have a +1 bonus to Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that require hearing.

entries.name: Birthstone.
entries: You can attune to a {@item Garnet|XDMG}. If you do, whenever you take the Help action, you gain a +1 AC bonus until the start of your next turn.
{@note {@table Astrological Signs|WM4}, Made by Landon}

reward.name: Sign of the Unicorn
entries: {@i Prerequisite: Born on the 10th Month, Marpenoth}
A creature can attune to their birthstone, treating a gem worth at least 50 gp as an item requiring attunement to gain the benefits of, though it is not magical.

entries.name: Optimal Career.
entries: You have a +2 bonus on Strength ({@skill Athletics}) checks to climb.

entries.name: Lucky Action.
entries: You have a +1 bonus to Strength ({@skill Athletics}) checks to Jump.

entries.name: Birthstone.
entries: You can attune to a {@item Topaz|XDMG}. If you do, you gain a +2 bonus on saving throws against poison and disease.
{@note {@table Astrological Signs|WM4}, Made by Landon}

reward.name: Sign of the Hydra
entries: {@i Prerequisite: Born on the 11th Month, Uktar}
A creature can attune to their birthstone, treating a gem worth at least 50 gp as an item requiring attunement to gain the benefits of, though it is not magical.

entries.name: Optimal Career.
entries: You have a +2 bonus on Charisma ({@skill Persuasion}) checks to ask for information.

entries.name: Lucky Action.
entries: You have a +1 bonus to Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatic}) checks.

entries.name: Birthstone.
entries: You can attune to a {@item Diamond|XDMG}. If you do, you gain a +2 AC bonus against attacks made while you are {@condition Paralyzed} or {@condition Unconscious}.
{@note {@table Astrological Signs|WM4}, Made by Landon}

reward.name: Sign of the Chimera
entries: {@i Prerequisite: Born on the 12th Month, Nightal}
A creature can attune to their birthstone, treating a gem worth at least 50 gp as an item requiring attunement to gain the benefits of, though it is not magical.

entries.name: Optimal Career.
entries: You have a +2 bonus on Charisma ({@skill Persuasion}) checks to make a first impression.

entries.name: Lucky Action.
entries: You have a +1 bonus to Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks.

entries.name: Birthstone.
entries: You can attune to an {@item Amethyst|XDMG}. If you do, you gain a +2 bonus on saving throws against evocation magic.
{@note {@table Astrological Signs|WM4}, Made by Landon}

reward.name: Beast Treats
entries: {@i Prerequisite: Beast Master}
You can take a {@action Magic|XPHB} action to feed your Primal Companion treats and expend a spell slot. After 1 minute, the beast has all its Hit Points restored.
(you can already do this but you have to kill the beast to do it normally)
{@note Made by Aris}

reward.name: Evil Brand
entries: You are physically marked forever as a servant of an evil power greater than yourself or as a villain who does not care who knows that you seek only death, destruction, and misery for others. The symbol is unquestionable in its evil, and all who see it know beyond a doubt that the bearer is forever in the sway of the blackest powers.

Evil creatures automatically recognize the symbol now emblazoned upon you as a sign of your utter depravity or discipleship to a powerful patron, although the specific identity of the patron is not revealed.
You gain a +2 bonus on {@skill Persuasion} and {@skill Intimidation} checks made against evil creatures.
{@note From 3.5e, ported by Aris}

reward.name: Spore Master
entries: {@i Prerequisite: Level 5, can cast {@spell animate dead|XPHB}}

When you cast {@spell animate dead|XPHB} targeting a corpse, you can choose to animate the corpse with spores instead of negative energy. When cast in this way, the target becomes a spore servant. A spore servant uses the {@creature zombie|XMM} statistics with the following changes:

items: The servant is a plant, not an undead
The servant's Intelligence is 2 (-4) and its Charisma is 1 (-5)
The servant has {@sense blindsight} with a radius of 30 feet, and is blind beyond this radius
The servant loses the undead fortitude trait and its darkvision

entries: You can target this spore servant with animate dead as if it was an undead creature. The spore servant remains animated for 30 days, or until it is reduced to 0 hit points. You cannot reanimate the corpse as a spore servant in this way again.
{@note Based on the spore servant template in the Monster Manual, and made in consideration of Spores Druids, which get animate dead as a spell. From S3. Made by Aris}

reward.name: Tamed Beast
entries: {@i Prerequisite: Beast Master}
When your Beast of the Land or Sea hits, you can choose to not {@condition Prone} or {@condition Grappled|XPHB|Grapple} the target.
{@note Made by Aris}

reward.name: Rat Whisperer
entries: You can cast {@spell Speak with Animals|XPHB} at will. When you cast it this way, you can only speak to {@creature rat|XMM|rats} that you are holding.
{@note Made by Gem}

reward.name: Mountable
entries: {@i Prerequisite: Centaur}
Your anatomy allows you to be an Independent Mount.
{@note Made by Landon}

reward.name: Abyss-bound Soul
entries: You have pledged your immortal soul to a particular demon lord in return for a gift that aids your evil works in life.

You are branded with the personal symbol of your demon lord patron, who watches over you from the Abyss. You gain a +2 bonus on saving throws made against good aligned spells. Additionally, a tiny portion of your patron’s power infuses your body, granting you an additional benefit. The exact benefit gained depends on who your patron is, as given below.

entries.name: Baphomet.
entries: If you move at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hit it with an attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra {@dice 2d8} damage. You can gain this benefit only once per turn.

entries.name: Dagon.
entries: You can breathe water as well as you can breathe air, and you can cast hunger of hadar once. You must finish a long rest before you can cast it again in this way.

entries.name: Demogorgon.
entries: You can cast {@spell summon greater demon|XGE} once. You must finish a long rest before you can cast it again in this way. Additionally, the CR of the demon summoned cannot be higher than your proficiency bonus. The demon has disadvantage on its saving throw to resist.

entries.name: Fraz-Urb’luu.
entries: Any spell slot you expend to cast an illusion spell counts as a spell slot of one level higher.

entries.name: Graz’zt.
entries: You are immune to the {@condition frightened} condition.

entries.name: Juiblex.
entries: You gain resistance to acid damage.

entries.name: Kostchtchie.
entries: You gain resistance to cold damage.

entries.name: Malcanthet.
entries: Any spell slot you expend to cast an enchantment spell counts as a spell slot of one level higher.

entries.name: Miska.
entries: You gain a climb speed equal to your walking speed, and can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

entries.name: Obox-ob.
entries: You know the {@spell infestation|XGE} cantrip, and you are resistant to poison damage. You can cast {@spell giant insect|XPHB} once. You must finish a long rest before you can cast it again in this way.

entries.name: Orcus.
entries: Any spell slot you expend to cast a necromancy spell counts as a spell slot of one level higher.

entries.name: Pale Night.
entries: You have immunity to insanity, madness, and confusion effects, including the {@condition confused|WM4} condition.

entries.name: Pazuzu.
entries: While airborne, you have a +2 bonus to your dexterity saving throws.

entries.name: Yeenoghu.
entries: You gain a +1 bonus on attack and damage rolls made with your natural weapons.

entries.name: Zuggtmoy.
entries: You are immune to additional damage from critical hits and sneak attacks.

entries.name: Abyssal Doom.
entries: When you die, your soul becomes claimed by your demon patron. You can be restored to life only by {@spell true resurrection|XPHB} or {@spell wish|XPHB}.
Charisma is your spellcasting ability for any spells in this talent.
{@note Adapted from 3.5e by Aris}

reward.name: Spellbreaker
entries: {@i Prerequisite: {@table Level 7 Gift Rewards|WM4|Level 7 Reward}}

When a creature within reach casts a spell, you can use your reaction to make a melee attack with a weapon or an Unarmed Strike against that creature. On a hit, it must make a saving throw to maintain Concentration. On a failure, the creature's spell fails and has no effect. The action, Bonus Action, or Reaction used to cast it is wasted and, if the spell was cast using a spell slot, the slot is also wasted.
As with any saving throw to maintain Concentration, the DC equals 10 or half the damage the creature takes, whichever number is higher, to a maximum DC of 30.
{@note Adapted from MW3. Made by V}

reward.name: Nothing Ever Happens
entries: {@i Well, would you look at the time...}

When a GM rolls on a random encounter table, you can expend a charge of this charm to instead have them roll a {@dice d100}. On a 1-36, nothing happens. On a 36-75, nothing happens. On a 75-99, nothing happens. On a 100, something happens, and they can roll again on their table.
While you have this charm, burgers are tasteless.
This charm comes with {@dice 1d4} charges. Once the last charge is expended, it disappears in a thoroughly disappointing and anticlimactic way.
{@note Repassing from S3, Made by Ryan}

reward.name: Something Just Happened
entries: If you, the player, are aware of something happening that your character isn't, such as due to a party split, you can use an action to use this charm to roll a DC 15 Constitution ({@skill Perception}) check. On a success, your character knows that Something Just Happened, as well as a general direction to where it happened, but absolutely no further information. Once used, this charm vanishes from you.
{@note Repassing from WM3, Made by V}

reward.name: Something Will Happened
entries: When a GM rolls for a Recharge ability, you can use this charm to have it automatically recharge the ability instead. Once you use this charm, it vanishes from you.
{@i I think something will happen!}
{@note Repassing from WM3, Made by Landon}

reward.name: Anonymity
entries: You have advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks made to hide in crowds of people.
{@note Made by Aris}

reward.name: Elysium Influence: Adequate Chef
entries: No matter how low you roll for Wisdom ({@item Cook's Utensils|XPHB}) to prepare a meal, your food cannot taste terrible. It tastes mediocre at worst.
{@note Made by Chrys}

reward.name: I Own a Musket For Home Defense
entries: You have advantage on attack rolls with {@item musket|XPHB|muskets} while in your home, as the founding fathers intended.
{@note Made by Lily}

reward.name: Legacy Carpenter
entries: {@i Prerequisite: {@item Carpenter's Tools|XPHB} proficiency}

entries.name: Fortify.
entries: With 1 minute of work and raw materials, you can make a door or window harder to force open. Increase the DC needed to open it by 5.

entries.name: Temporary Shelter.
entries: As part of a Long Rest, you can construct a lean-to or a similar shelter to keep your group dry and in the shade for the duration of the rest. Because it was fashioned quickly from whatever wood was available, the shelter collapses {@dice 1d3} days after being assembled.
{@note From 2014, ported by Aris}

reward.name: Legacy Mason
entries: {@i Prerequisite: {@item Mason's Tools|XPHB} proficiency}

entries.name: Demolition.
entries: Your knowledge of masonry allows you to spot weak points in brick walls. You deal double damage to such structures with your weapon attacks.
{@note From 2014, ported by Aris}

reward.name: Legacy Tinkerer
entries: {@i Prerequisite: {@item Tinker's Tools|XPHB} proficiency}

entries.name: Repair.
entries: You can restore 10 hit points to a damaged object for each hour of work. For any object, you need access to the raw materials required to repair it. For metal objects, you need access to an open flame hot enough to make the metal pliable.
{@note From 2014, ported by Aris}

reward.name: Opening Tap
entries: You can use any hard blunt object, such as a pommel of a blade or another lock, as {@item Thieves' Tools|XPHB} for the purposes of opening a nonmagical lock.
{@note Inspired by the 3.5e Opening Tap skill trick, Made by Aris}

reward.name: Owlbears are Owl Bears!
entries: You can treat {@creature owlbear|XMM|Owlbears} as Beasts for the sake of your features and spells.
{@note Made by Landon}

reward.name: Ratapult
entries: {@i Prerequisite: Can cast {@spell Catapult|XGE}}
When you cast {@spell Catapult|XGE}, you can target a {@creature Rat|XMM} to launch instead of an object.
{@note Made by Gem}

reward.name: Shielding Arm
entries: {@i Prerequisite: {@item Shield|XPHB} Training

As an Action while your hand is empty, you can shift your stance to one of defense. While in this stance, you can use your empty hand as a donned {@item shield|XPHB}. While in this stance, you can't hold or manipulate items in that hand. You can exit this stance as an Action.
{@note Made by Landon}

reward.name: Shielding Stance
entries: {@i Prerequisite: {@item Shield|XPHB} Training

As a {@action Utilize|XPHB} action while holding a weapon, you can shift the way you hold one of your weapons you are holding to a stance of defense. While in this stance, treat the weapon as a {@item shield|XPHB}. While in this stance, you can't make attacks with that weapon.

Additionally while in this stance, you can't be disarmed of that weapon, and it takes a {@action Utilize|XPHB} action to drop the weapon, thereby ending the stance. You can also exit this stance as a {@action Utilize|XPHB} action.
{@note Made by Aris}

reward.name: Spirit of Encouragement
entries: {@i In times of stress, a small incorporeal spirit manifests behind you, holding onto your back. This spirit provides encouragement and consoles negative emotions.}
When forced to make a saving throw to avoid falling into despair or otherwise allowing a form of sadness to take hold of you, you roll that saving throw with advantage.
In addition, a creature with this perk is convinced that luck is on their side, even when that might not be the case.
{@i Keep on rushing forward!}
{@note Made by Patrick}

reward.name: Up the Hill
entries: {@i "When I was a kid I used to walk to school uphill both ways"}
You can run up steep inclines or stairs without it costing extra movement (if the GM would rule it as costing extra movement).
{@note Made by Aris}

reward.name: Up the Hill
entries: You can cast {@spell Speak with Animals|XPHB} at will. When you cast it this way, you can only speak to {@creature rat|XMM|rats} that you are holding.
{@note Made by Gem}

reward.name: Theme Music
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can create music in a 120-foot Emanation from you. This music ends when you desire (no action required) or when you become {@condition Incapacitated}.
{@note Talent of {@item Wand of Conducting|XDMG}, Made by Landon}

reward.name: Non-Alcoholic Drinker
entries: You can drink ale, wine, or any other nonmagical alcoholic beverage without becoming inebriated. This has no effect on magical liquids or harmful substances such as poison.
{@note Talent of {@item Tankard of Sobriety|XDMG}, Made by Marvin}

reward.name: Special Technique: Dropkick!
entries: Whenever you make an Unarmed Strike against a creature, if you are not Prone or immune to the {@condition Prone} condition, you may attempt to dropkick your target. The attack deals an additional 2 Bludgeoning damage on a hit, but you become {@condition prone} after the attack. You may only make this special attack once per turn.
{@note Made by Patrick}

reward.name: The Spin!
entries: You may treat individual {@item ball bearings|XPHB|ball bearings} from a pouch as a martial ranged weapon. {@item ball bearings|XPHB|Ball bearings} have the Finesse and Thrown (30/120 ft.) properties. {@item ball bearings|XPHB|Ball bearings} deal {@dice 1d6} bludgeoning damage on a hit. They have the Vex weapon mastery.
{@note Inspired by Jojo's Bizarre Adventure: Part 7 - Steel Ball Run, Reworked from WM3. Made by Patrick}

reward.name: Tidal Dash
entries: When you take the {@action Dash|XPHB} action, you can move through the spaces of other creatures until the end of your turn. If you pass through the space of a creature of your size or smaller during this time, you can force the creature to make a DC 13 Strength saving throw. On a failure, you can push them 5 feet in a direction of your choice. A creature can be pushed only once a turn by this talent.
{@note Made by Aris}

reward.name: Arena Blood
entries: {@note Exotic: An item that is not necessarily magical, but is difficult to acquire and can only be purchased under certain circumstances.}
{@i The blood of an arena champion flows in your veins, giving you a thirst for glory and a drive to succeed.}

You get a +2 bonus on Charisma ({@skill Intimidation}) checks. In addition, if you successfully intimidate a Hostile creature using the {@action Influence|XPHB} action in combat, you gain {@dice 1d4} Temporary hit points. You lose these temporary hit points at the start of your next turn.

While fighting for the entertainment of onlookers, such as a fight in an arena or a sparring match, you gain a +2 bonus to your DCs to Grapple or Shove, and a +2 bonus to any Battlemaster Maneuvers or Weapon Masteries. The GM can determine what fights this applies to.
{@note From 3.5e, ported by Aris}

reward.name: Child of the Shadow
entries: {@note Exotic: An item that is not necessarily magical, but is difficult to acquire and can only be purchased under certain circumstances.}
{@i You're used to the streets and back alleys and have refined several talents and tricks valuable to survival in rougher neighborhoods.}

You know Sasserine’s black market quite well, and need not make checks to locate its outlets. Further, in other cities, you have a knack for rooting out the underground markets. You gain a +2 bonus on Charisma ({@skill Persuasion} and {@skill Investigation}) checks made to learn about a city’s black markets.

Your experience has also equipped you with several tricks you can use to ensure survival. You gain a +2 bonus to Initiative in urban environments. You are also adept at fighting in confined areas, such as narrow city alleyways or crowded taprooms. Your melee weapon attacks and Unarmed Strikes ignore Half and Three-Quarters Cover.
{@note From 3.5e, ported by Aris}

reward.name: Knack for Magic
entries: {@note Exotic: An item that is not necessarily magical, but is difficult to acquire and can only be purchased under certain circumstances.}
{@i Magic is not that mysterious to you, and its gifts have made your life a little easier.}

You get a +2 bonus to Intelligence (Arcana) checks made to identify spells. In addition, you have an innate talent for magic. You can cast the following spells: {@spell Prestidigitation|XPHB}, {@spell Light|XPHB}, {@spell Detect Magic|XPHB}.

Once you cast a spell with this talent, you cannot cast that spell again until you finish a long rest. Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for this talent's spells (choose when you gain this talent).
{@note From 3.5e, ported by Aris}

reward.name: Merchant’s Tongue
entries: {@note Exotic: An item that is not necessarily magical, but is difficult to acquire and can only be purchased under certain circumstances.}
{@i Your practices in trade made you glib and gave you a keen eye for value.}
You have a +2 bonus to checks made to identify an object, and you can automatically determine the monetary value of any treasure (art object) you see.

In addition, whenever you sell an object, you can take the {@action Influence|XPHB} Action (DC 20) as if the creature was Hesitant. On a success, you can sell the object for up to 20% over its asking price.
{@note From 3.5e, ported by Aris}

reward.name: Student of Nature
entries: {@note Exotic: An item that is not necessarily magical, but is difficult to acquire and can only be purchased under certain circumstances.}
{@i The wild has always excited you with its simple beauty and majestic creatures. It is no wonder that many of your talents let you better enjoy the natural world.}

You get a +1 bonus to Wisdom ({@skill Animal Handling} or {@skill Survival}), and Intelligence ({@skill Nature}) checks. You also get a +2 bonus on Constitution saving throws made to resist effects originating from a Plant creature.
{@note From 3.5e, ported by Aris}

reward.name: Suspicious Eye
entries: {@note Exotic: An item that is not necessarily magical, but is difficult to acquire and can only be purchased under certain circumstances.}
{@i You are always on the lookout for treachery and wrongdoing.}
You gain a +2 bonus to Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) checks made to determine a creature's intentions with you.
In addition, you have a +5 bonus to your Passive Perception against attempts to pickpocket or steal from you. If you notice the creature, you can make an opportunity attack against that creature.
{@note From 3.5e, ported by Aris}

reward.name: Water Rat
entries: {@note Exotic: An item that is not necessarily magical, but is difficult to acquire and can only be purchased under certain circumstances.}
{@i You've learned to swim well, and take to the water as easily as land.}

You gain a +2 bonus on Strength ({@skill Athletics}) checks made to swim. When wearing light or no armor and not Encumbered or {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB|Exhausted}, you have a swim speed equal to your walking speed. If you already have a swim speed, it is increased by 10 feet. While swimming, you gain a +2 bonus to Initiative.
{@note From 3.5e, ported by Aris}

reward.name: Blessing of Increased Ability
entries: {@i Prerequisite: {@table Level 7 Gift Rewards|WM4|Level 7 Reward}}
Choose an Ability Score. It increases by 2, up to a maximum of 20.
When you finish a long rest, you can change which Ability Score you increase with this gift.
{@note Made by Landon}

reward.name: Dropkick of Doom
entries: {@i Prerequisite: {@reward Special Technique: Dropkick!|WM4} talent}

When you dropkick a creature, the creature is pushed 5 feet away from you if it is no more than one size larger than you. In addition, you may make any of your unarmed strikes into a dropkick attack, instead of one per turn.
{@note Made by Patrick}

reward.name: Oiled Up
entries: Your hair and skin is constantly oily. You sweat oil.
{@note Made by Gem}

reward.name: You First.
entries: Whether it's because you are aura farming, are overly polite, or just have a godlike reaction speed, whenever you would roll initiative, you instead get an initiative of 0. If you still go before someone else, you can point and laugh at them.
{@note Made by Christopher}

reward.name: Pretty Bad Medicine, Actually
entries: {@i This is serious, asshole.}
Whenever you, the player, laugh, your character takes {@dice 1d6} psychic damage.
{@note Inspired by Legends of Avantris, Made by Lily}

reward.name: Lycanthropy (shark)
entries: {@i You are heavily swayed to a Neutral Evil alignment, become a Monstrosity (Lycanthrope), and gain minor shark-like features.}

entries.name: Shape-Shift
entries: As a Bonus Action, you can shape-shift into a Shark or Shark-Hybrid. While a Shark or Shark-Hybrid, you have a blindsight of 30 feet, a swim speed of 40 feet. While as a Shark-Hybrid, you can breathe air and water. While as a Shark, you are Large and can breathe only underwater. Your game statistics are otherwise the same in each form, though you cannot speak if you are a Shark. Any equipment you are wearing or carrying isn't transformed. Worn equipment functions as normal, but the DM decides whether it's practical for the new form to wear or wield a piece of equipment. You can use another Bonus Action to shape-shift back.

entries.name: Bite
entries: While you are a Shark or Shark Hybrid, you manifest a natural weapon. It counts as a simple melee weapon for you, and you add your Strength modifier to the attack and damage rolls when you attack with it, as normal. You have advantage on attack rolls with this weapon against {@status Bloodied|XPHB} creatures.

It deals {@dice 2d8} piercing damage on a hit. A damaged creature is subjected to the following effect. Constitution Saving Throw: DC 14. Failure: The target gains this curse. Success: The target is immune to your curse for 24 hours. A creature automatically succeeds if it cannot become a Lycanthrope, like most non-Humanoids.

entries.name: Transformation
entries: When you start your turn next to a {@status bloodied|XPHB} enemy, you must make a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, you lose control of yourself and shape-shift into a Shark or Shark-Hybrid, and cannot shape-shift back into your true form until there are no {@status Bloodied|XPHB} creatures other than you within 120 feet of you. You have no memory of your actions during this time, the GM having control over those actions instead.
{@note Formatted like Landon's Lycanthropy curse, Made by Aris}

reward.name: Endless Dreamer
entries: {@i Special Curse}
Your dreams often stretch on endlessly, and years could pass in your dreams when only hours pass in reality. You remember most of your dreams, even if somewhat hazy.
{@note Made by Aris}

reward.name: Vile Damage
entries: {@i Special Curse}

Vile damage is a special curse. Every point of vile damage reduces your current hit points by 1. These lost hit points can only be restored by healing magic in a consecrated area such as the Hallow spell. Vile damage represents such an evil violation to a character’s body or soul that only in a holy place can healing magic repair the damage.
Vile damage is usually done in increments of 1 damage per infliction
{@note Made by Aris}

reward.name: Arms Dealer Dealer
entries: You’ve earned the respect of Castil, premier gunsmith of Westgate. He offers a small discount at his shop, access to more select merchandise, and more jobs when he has them.
{@note Made by Lily}

reward.name: Dingy Hospitality
entries: You have the protection of Balabar Smenk, an upstart criminal from Westgate. When in Westgate, you can find a place to hide, rest, or recuperate within the criminal network, unless you have shown yourself to be a danger to those who are sheltering you. They will shield you from the law or anyone else searching for you, though they will not risk their lives for you.
{@note Made by Chrys}

reward.name: Efreeti's Serf
entries: {@i Your soul is binded to an {@creature Efreeti|XMM} in order to do its whims.}
You are {@condition Charmed} by that {@creature Efreeti|XMM}. They have a telepathic link with you.
As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, that {@creature Efreeti|XMM} can deal {@dice 5d10} Fire damage to you. This damage cannot be reduced in any way.
When you deal Fire damage to a creature, you can have that creature start burning. Once you use this feature, you cannot do so again until you finish a long rest.
{@note Made by Landon}

reward.name: Greased Hog Lightning
entries: The Hoggler is known throughout Raven's Bluff to have killed a goblin under the Crossed Quils' House while covered in Grease. Local legends are formed around this event.
{@note Made by Patrick}

reward.name: Vow of Kindness to Beasts
entries: You have promised to never harm a beast.
You have a +1 to Wisdom ({@skill Animal Handling}) checks. If you ever willingly harm a beast except in self-defense, you instead have a -5 penalty to Wisdom ({@skill Animal Handling}) checks.
{@note Made by Landon}

reward.name: Starmantle's Gratitude
entries: You've extinguished the inferno and felled the first Machine. As such, you have the deepest thanks of Starmantle's people.
{@note Made by Christopher}

reward.name: [SMP] Banned for Life
entries: You have committed a dastardly crime against The Scholars of Millenniums Past, and have been banned from their libraries permanently. If you are found out to be banned while trespassing onto their property, hostile action will be taken. While other libraries don't immediately take this as proof of bad book lending, many will be hesitant to let you visit.
{@note Made by Gem}

reward.name: [SMP] Card Holder
entries: You have been recognized as responsible enough to check out books from any Scholars of Millenniums Past' library. As a highly prestigious library organization, many non-associated libraries accept this membership as well.
{@note Made by Gem}

reward.name: [SMP] Scholar
entries: Due to your dedication or assistance to The Scholars of Millenniums Past, you have shown yourself to be trustworthy. You receive preferential treatment over simple Card Holders. Additionally, you are allowed to start your own library under their name, and they will provide aid to do such.
{@note Made by Gem}

reward.name: Well-Studied Illusionist
entries: {@i Prerequisite: Illusionist Wizard}
{@spell Silence|XPHB} is added to your spell list, and is treated as a Wizard spell for you.
{@note Made by Gem}

reward.name: Abyssal Influence: Bloody Ichor
entries: When you die, you leave a puddle of demon ichor in your space. It dissolves after 24 hours.
(can only be given with the players' permission)
{@note Made by Aris}

reward.name: Bottleable
entries: {@i Prerequisite: Ooze}

As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action you are to shrink your form in order to fit into an open bottle, flask, vial, or other tiny container. While in the bottle, you are able to be concealed by another creature, allowing you to share its Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks to remain unseen. If the container is open, you can leave it using half of your movement. If the container is nonmagically sealed, you are unable to leave but can use an action to make a DC 10 Strength saving throw in order to break out of the container. If the container is magically sealed, you are unable to break out in this way.
{@note Made by Gem}

reward.name: Monster Masher
entries: You have Advantage on Charisma ({@skill Performance}, {@skill Persuasion}) checks made to convince a Monstrosity or Undead to join an ongoing dance.
{@note Made by Gem}

reward.name: Dice Goblin
entries: You can attune to multiple {@item Charlatan's Die|XDMG} at once, and they all count as the same attunement.
{@note Made by Aris}

reward.name: Door Buster
entries: {@i You are adept in knocking doors off their hinges}
You gain a +4 bonus to Strength checks to break down doors. This bonus does not stack with a Portable Ram.
{@note Perk of {@item Portable Ram|XPHB}, Made by Gem}

reward.name: Evil Brand: Mark of Chains
entries: You are physically marked forever as a servant of an evil power greater than yourself or as a villain who does not care who knows that you seek only death, destruction, and misery for others. The symbol is unquestionable in its evil, and all who see it know beyond a doubt that the bearer is forever in the sway of the blackest powers.
If you already have {@reward Evil Brand|WM4} when you receive this Perk, you can choose for this Perk's features to replace {@reward Evil Brand|WM4|Evil Brand's}; else, this Perk has no effect.

Evil creatures automatically recognize the chain link symbol now emblazoned upon you as a sign of your utter depravity or discipleship to a powerful patron, although the specific identity of the patron is not revealed.
You gain a +1 bonus on your save DCs to Grapple and Escape a Grapple.
{@note Made by Chrys}

reward.name: Food Feelings
entries: When you take the {@action Search|XPHB} action, you can target a creature and make a Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) check against their Passive Charisma ({@skill Deception}). On a success, you learn what their Super All-Time Favorite Food is, and their Worst Most Hated Food ever is. On a failure, that creature becomes immune to this ability for 24 hours.
{@note Made by Landon}

reward.name: Hand-Eye Coordination
entries: Your hands function as a {@item Spyglass|XPHB} when positioned in front of an eye as one.
{@note Made by Landon}

reward.name: Juggler
entries: When you hit another creature of one size larger than you or smaller with a weapon attack, you can cause that creature to not fall until the end of your next turn.
{@note Made by Aris}

reward.name: Kyton's Chains
entries: You can use {@item Manacles|XPHB} or {@item chain|XPHB|Chains} on a creature within 10 feet of yourself, rather than 5.
Additionally, you can use {@item chain|XPHB|Chains} as a {@item Whip|XPHB}, dealing either Bludgeoning or Slashing damage on a hit (depending on the nature of the chain).
{@note Made by Aris}

reward.name: Let's get the facts!
entries: When you take the {@action Search|XPHB} action, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on the next {@action Study|XPHB} action you make before the end of your next turn if you {@action Study|XPHB} whatever you {@action Search|XPHB|Searched}.
{@note Made by Landon}

reward.name: Looks away from camera...
entries: You always know what direction to look away from the camera.
{@note Made by Aris}

reward.name: Mag-nificent!
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on any ability check made to appraise or inspect a highly detailed item. You can also light a fire with if you have light as bright as sunlight to focus, tinder to ignite. It takes about 5 minutes for the fire to ignite.
{@note Made by Landon}

reward.name: Neurotoxin
entries: {@i Prerequisite: Cunning Strike, Soulknife Rogue}
You do not need a {@item Poisoner's Kit|XPHB} on your person to use the Poison option of Cunning Strike on attacks with your {@item Psychic Blade|XPHB|Psychic Blades}.
{@note Made by Aris}

reward.name: Question for the Producer...
entries: When a session finishes, you (the player) can ask the GM 1 question. The GM must answer (though not necessarily truthfully)
{@i Wait, you could always just do this.}
{@note Made by Landon}

reward.name: Silly Guy
entries: You have a tiny spirit resembling a creature (Chosen when you receive this perk) that constantly follows you. It can emote in response to what is going on around you, but it has no statblock, cannot perform any actions, and cannot convey any useful information. The Silly Guy adapts to any environment, changing its form to accommodate including allowing it to swim, fly, or move in any other way. If it is ever more than 60 ft from you, it instantly teleports to your side.
As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action you can dismiss any number of Silly Guys you have. You can resummon any number of Silly Guys as a {@action Magic|XPHB} action.
You can receive this perk multiple times, gaining a different Silly Guy of the DMs choice each time.
{@note Made by Gem}

reward.name: Slap of Life
entries: You can take the {@action Help|XPHB} action to try to stabilize via slap a creature with 0 Hit Points, which requires a successful DC 10 Strength ({@skill Athletics|XPHB}) check.
{@note Made by Gem}

reward.name: Stabilizer
entries: {@i Prerequisite: {@skill Medicine} Proficiency}
You can take the {@action Help|XPHB} action to stabilize an Unconscious creature that has 0 Hit Points without needing to make a Wisdom ({@skill Medicine}) check.
{@note Perk of {@item Healer's Kit|XPHB}. Made by Gem}

reward.name: Tactical Backflip
entries: Whenever you're subjected to an effect that allows you to make a Dexterity saving throw, you can take a Reaction to do a cool backflip. If you do, you get a -1 penalty to that saving throw.
{@note Made by Christopher}

reward.name: Taxi!
entries: As an {@action Influence|XPHB} action, you can try to summon private transportation. Sometime between your next turn and forever later, up to GM's discretion, such transportation will arrive, though they will still charge a fare. (Regular fees are 3 cp per mile, or 1 cp for inner-city travel).
{@note Made by Landon}

reward.name: Thrall to Demon
entries: You formally supplicate yourself to a demon prince. In return for this obedience, you gain a small measure of the demon prince's power.

While performing an evil or chaotic act, you can call upon your demonic patron and gain a +1 bonus on {@variantrule D20 test|XPHB}. Once you gain this benefit, you cannot do so again until you finish a Long Rest.
{@note From 3.5e. Made by Aris}

reward.name: Vecna's Most Vile Technique
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Dexterity ({@skill Sleight of Hand}) checks to steal candy from a baby.
{@note Made by Gem}

reward.name: Well Traveled
entries: You have expert knowledge on the layout of an area (Chosen when you receive this perk).
You have a +5 bonus to Wisdom ({@skill Survival}) checks you make to find your way in the area. This bonus does not stack with {@item Map|XPHB|Maps}.
You can receive this perk multiple times, gaining knowledge in a different area.
{@note Perk of {@item Map|XPHB}, Made by Gem}

reward.name: Dark Speech Novice
entries: You have managed to learn a word in Dark Speech, though you lack the proper magical protection to speak it. As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can attempt to speak this word, and you die.
{@note Made by Aris}

reward.name: Freaky
entries: You are considered {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficient} with your tongue.
{@note Made by Gem}

reward.name: Lucky Thief
entries: {@i No amount of Expertise can stop some good old fashioned Luck}

You can use a {@action Magic|XPHB} action to attempt to unlock a locked door. This has a 5 percent chance of unlocking any lock. Once you use this ability, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.
{@note Talent of {@item Mystery Key|XDMG} Made by Gem}

reward.name: Ough, Sour...
entries: {@i Prerequisite: Ooze}
You have learned how to become a living weapon, a sapient amalgam of unripe fruits and scrunched facial expressions. When you are hit by a Bite attack, you may have the attacker take 1 Acid damage.
{@note Made by Christopher}

reward.name: Tracker's Sense
entries: Through some magical means, you are able to detect the presence of a certain type of creature, determined when you gain this talent. Once determined, the creature type can't be changed.

You know when you are within 300 feet of any creature of that type. This presence could be indicated by varying means, depending on the nature that you gained this talent, and it can be a visual indicator.
{@note Talent of {@item Lantern of Tracking|IDRotF}. Made by Aris}

reward.name: Tummy Vision
entries: When you take the {@action Search|XPHB} action, you can target a creature within 5 feet and make a DC 15 Wisdom ({@skill Medicine}) check. On a success, you can reason what they last ate in the last 24 hours.
{@note Made by Landon}

reward.name: 1500 XXL Westmarch Cypher
entries: At the GM’s discretion, you can record a 30 second to 1 minute long freestyle rap in character. The beat is up to the discretion of the GM (a sample beat is provided here). At the conclusion of the freestyle, the GM decides if you produced a banger. If you did, you heal {@dice 2d10} Hit Points, if you didn’t, you take {@dice 2d10} Fire damage. The GM may require that you post the recording in ⁠#wm-discussion to benefit. Once this talent is used, it cannot be used again until one week has passed.
{@note Made by Ryan Gabrillo}

reward.name: Aerial Fighting
entries: You can use the momentum of your strikes to keep you airborne. When you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack while airborne, you can choose to not fall until the end of your next turn.
{@note Made by Aris}

reward.name: Blasphemous
entries: You can cast {@spell Desecrate|WM4} (spellcasting ability mod +3) with this talent. When you cast {@spell Desecrate|WM4} this way, the Duration is 1 minute. You can't cast this spell again with this talent until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.
{@note Made by Chrys}

reward.name: Demon Eye
entries: You have {@sense Darkvision} out to 60 feet. If you already have {@sense Darkvision}, its range increases by 60 feet.
When you take the {@action Search|XPHB} action and roll a 1 on the die, you are {@condition Blinded} for the next 10 minutes.
{@note Made by Chrys}

reward.name: Demon Leg
entries: {@i Your leg is possessed by a demon, or demonic essence, transforming to become a more demonic form.}
Your {@variantrule Long Jump|XPHB} is increased by 20 feet, and your {@variantrule High Jump|XPHB} is increased by 10 feet, when you have a running start.

When you roll a 1 on a Strength or Dexterity saving throw, you lose control of your movement. At the start of your next turn, you must choose to either drop {@condition Prone|XPHB}, or to use all your movement to move in a random direction.
{@note Made by Aris}

reward.name: Eye for Secrets
entries: {@i Through rigorous training, you have developed a keen eye for secrets and traps.}
As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action you can attempt to detect secrets. If a secret door or trap is within 60 feet of you, you sense the location of the one nearest to you.
You can use this {@variantrule Talents|WM4|Talent} a number of times equal to your Proficiency Bonus, regaining uses on a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.
{@note Talent of {@item Wand of Secrets|XDMG}, Made by Gem}

reward.name: Eyes of an Adventurer
entries: {@i "You can see it in their eyes when an adventurer walks through the door" - Random barkeep
You gain a {@sense Darkvision} of 60 ft if you do not already have one. Your eyes additionally reflect more light than usual, making them appear to glow in the dark.
You cannot benefit from wearing {@item Goggles of Night|XDMG}.
{@note Talent of {@item Goggles of Night|XDMG}, Made by Gem}

reward.name: Graceful Landing
entries: {@i Prerequisite: {@skill Acrobatics} Proficiency}
Whenever you fall, you always land on your feet. Additionally, your falls count as having fallen 20 less feet for the purposes of taking damage from falling (to a minimum of 0 feet).
{@note Talent of Boots of Landing, Made by Gem}

reward.name: Maimer's Mercy
entries: You have achieved mastery over your attacks, and can accurately navigate the line between life and death. You can knock out creatures with any attack, not just melee attacks.
Made by Corvus

reward.name: Meticulous Hands
entries: {@i You've learned to slow down and be precise with your movements.}
While you are not wearing gloves, you gain a +5 bonus to Dexterity ({@skill Sleight of Hand}) checks.
{@note Talent of {@item Gloves of Thievery|XDMG}, Made by Gem}

reward.name: Silent Shooter
entries: {@i Prerequisite: Proficiency in Firearms or Martial weapons}
You know how to modify your firearms to fire silently. When you make an attack with a firearm, you can choose for it to make no sound.
{@note Made by Aris}

reward.name: Silken Anchor
entries: {@i Prerequisite: {@item Weaver's Tools|XPHB} Proficiency}

You learn to use silk to anchor your thrown weapons to your person. When you make a ranged attack roll using a weapon that has the Thrown property, you can use a Bonus Action on the same turn to pull the weapon back to your empty hand.
{@note Made by Chrys}

reward.name: Shattered Remains
entries: When you kill a creature, you can choose for the creature's remains to turn into glass and shatter into pieces. The target can be revived only by a {@spell True Resurrection|XPHB} or a {@spell Wish|XPHB} spell.
{@note Made by Chrys}

reward.name: Stiff Legs
entries: You do not gain the {@condition Prone} condition from becoming {@condition Unconscious}.
{@note Made by Gem}

reward.name: Take chances, make mistakes, and get messy!
entries: When you reroll a die with {@variantrule Heroic Inspiration|XPHB}, if it was a d20 as part of a {@variantrule D20 test|XPHB}, you can add {@dice 1d4} to the total.
Once you use this feature, you cannot do so again for the rest of the session.
{@note Made by Landon}

reward.name: Helm Breaker
entries: Once per turn, when you hit an airborne creature one size larger than you or smaller with a melee weapon attack, you can push the creature up to 30 feet downward. If the creature collides with a solid surface, it takes damage as though it had fallen the distance it was pushed.
{@note Made by Aris}

reward.name: Maybe the back door is unlocked?
entries: {@i Prerequisite: {@reward Lucky Thief|WM4}}
{@i If life gives you a locked door, find another one.}
You can use your {@reward Lucky Thief|WM4} talent an unlimited number of times, but only once per door.
{@note Talent of {@item Ring of Mystery Keys|WM4}, Made by Gem}

reward.name: Mists of the North Wind
entries: {@i Prerequisite: Wild Shape feature}

As a Bonus action, you can expend a use of your Wild Shape to take on a gaseous shape. This functions as the {@spell Gaseous Form|XPHB} spell, except it targets only you, and does not require {@status Concentration|XPHB} to maintain. It lasts for a number of hours equal to half your Druid level (rounded down). You can revert to your normal form earlier by using a Bonus action on your turn. You automatically revert if you fall {@condition Unconscious}, drop to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, or die.
{@note Made by Aris}

reward.name: Breeze of the South Wind
entries: {@i Prerequisite: Cunning Action feature}

You can use the Bonus action granted by your Cunning Action to cast the {@spell Zephyr Strike|XGE} spell. When you cast it in this way, it doesn't require components nor a spell slot, and while under its effects you leave no tracks. Once you cast the spell, you cannot do so again with this {@variantrule Talents|WM4|Talent} until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.
{@note Made by Aris}

reward.name: Gale of the East Wind
entries: {@i Prerequisite: Arcane Recovery feature}

When you gain the benefits of your arcane recovery feature, you can choose one of your spells that you have prepared that requires {@status Concentration|XPHB}. The next time you cast that spell and {@status Concentration|XPHB|Concentrate} on it, you also gain the benefits of the {@spell Warding Wind|XGE} spell for its duration.
{@note Made by Aris}

reward.name: Breath of the West Wind
entries: {@i Prerequisite: Channel Divinity feature}

As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can expend a use of your Channel Divinity, and bestow yourself or a creature within 30 feet of you the freedom of the winds. The creature gains the benefits of the {@spell Freedom of Movement|XPHB} spell, which lasts for 10 minutes.
{@note Made by Aris}

reward.name: Radiant Beams
entries: {@i Prerequisite: {@spell Eldritch Blast|XPHB}}
You can deal Radiant damage instead of Force when you cast {@spell Eldritch Blast|XPHB}. If you change the damage type this way, the damage die becomes {@dice 1d8}.
{@note Made by Landon}

reward.name: Sorrow Taint
entries: {@i Tears streak down your face, staining your skin; Your sorrows and inhibitions heighten.}

entries.name: Weight of Grief.
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you point at a creature within 60 feet of you, filling it with deep sorrow. It must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on {@variantrule D20 test|XPHB|D20 tests} until the start of your next turn.

entries.name: Heightened Empathy.
entries: Your constant grief deepens your understanding of others’s feelings. You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) checks made to discern a creature’s emotions. If you roll a 20 on the die when making a Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) check, you are {@condition Dazed|WM4} and {@condition Immobilized|WM4} until the end of your next turn, as your own sorrows overtake you.
All DCs from this talent are equal to 8 + your Proficiency Bonus + your Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma modifier (your choice when you receive this talent).
{@note Made by Chrys}

reward.name: Spiral Taint
entries: {@i A constant and ever changing fractal has taken hold of your mind; spiral patterns form on your body with no consistency.}

entries.name: Sight of the Abyss.
entries: You can cast {@spell Vision of Entropy|WM4} at will.

entries.name: Touch of Insanity.
entries: Once on your turn, when you hit a creature with a melee attack or Unarmed Strike, you can force the creature to make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, the creature is {@condition Confused|WM4} until the start of your next turn.

entries.name: Fractal Mind.
entries: There is nothing left to break. You automatically succeed on {@variantrule saving throw|XPHB|saving throws} made to retain your sanity. You have a -3 penalty on all Wisdom based {@variantrule ability check|XPHB|ability checks} and {@variantrule saving throw|XPHB|saving throws}; whenever you roll a 1 on a {@variantrule D20 test|XPHB}, you are {@condition Confused|WM4} until the end of your next turn.
All DCs from this talent are equal to 8 + your Proficiency Bonus + your Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma modifier (your choice when you receive this talent).
{@note Made by Chrys}

reward.name: Paladin's Wrath
entries: {@i Replaces the Paladin's Smite feature}

You always have the {@spell Wrathful Smite|XPHB} spell prepared. When you cast {@spell Wrathful Smite|XPHB}, you deal Radiant damage instead of Necrotic, and you cast it as though it used a spell slot 2 levels higher, to a maximum of level 5. In addition, you can cast it without using a spell slot, but you must finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB} before you can cast it this way again.
{@note Made by Gavin}

reward.name: Vistani Evil Eye
entries: {@i Prerequisite: Spellcasting Class Feature}

entries.name: Vistani Curse Magic.
entries: You learn the spell {@spell Bestow Curse|XPHB} and always have it prepared. When you cast it this way, you instead make a Ranged Spell Attack with a Range of 30 feet, casting it at its Level 3 version. When the target fails the saving throw, you alternatively choose the nature of the curse from the following options:

items: The target is unable to perform a certain kind of act involving fine motor control, such as tying knots, writing, playing an instrument, sewing, or casting spells that have Somatic components. When this curse ends, you take {@dice 2d6} Psychic damage.

The target's appearance changes in a sinister yet purely cosmetic way. For example, the curse can place a scar on the target's face, turn the target's teeth into yellow fangs, or give the target bad breath. When this curse ends, you take {@dice 2d6} Psychic damage.

A nonmagical item in the target's possession (chosen by the DM) disappears and can't be found until the curse ends. The lost item can weigh no more than 1 pound. When this curse ends, you take {@dice 2d6} Psychic damage.
The target has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on ability checks and saving throws tied to one ability score of your choice. When this curse ends, you take {@dice 6d6} Psychic damage.
The target's attunement to one magic item of your choice ends. When this curse ends, you take {@dice 10d6} Psychic damage, and the target automatically reattunes to the item.
The target is {@condition Blinded}, {@condition Deafened}, or both (your choice). When this curse ends, you take {@dice 10d6} Psychic damage.

entries.name: Evil Eye.
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can target a creature within 10 feet that you can see. This magical ability, which the Vistani call the Evil Eye, duplicates the duration and effect of the {@spell Animal Friendship|XPHB}, {@spell Charm Person|XPHB}, or {@spell Hold Person|XPHB} spell (your choice), but requires neither Somatic nor Material components. If the target succeeds on the save, you are {@condition Blinded} until the end of your next turn. When you use this feature, you cannot do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.
The DC for these effects uses your spellcasting DC.
{@note Made by Chrys}

reward.name: Whirlwind Strike!
entries: {@i Prerequisite: Extra Attack}
{@i don't cry because it's over. attack. attack everything around you. do spin attacks}

You can do spin attacks. You can use an Action to make a Melee Weapon Attack against any number of creatures within 5 feet of you, with a separate attack roll for each target. You can make this attack twice, regaining one of its expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB}, and all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.
{@note Made by Chrys}

reward.name: Terminal Terminal Velocity
entries: There is no longer a maximum amount of damage you take from the Falling Hazard.
{@note Made by Landon}

reward.name: The MacLeod Effect
entries: Whenever you succeed on a Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) check made to {@action Hide|XPHB}, Sneaky Snitch plays from around you and can be heard in a 30 foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from yourself.
{@note Made by Chrys}

reward.name: Tears of Sorrow
entries: {@i Special Curse}

You cannot stop crying. Everything that was; every wish for what could've been; the yearn of what you could be; all of these reverberate through your mind- through each action you take- as an incessant reminder of your loss and grief. These tears are shed and you cannot bring yourself to cease them.
{@note Made by Chrys}
As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action you can expend this charm to give yourself the {@condition Petrified} condition.
{@note Made by Gem}

reward.name: Carcinization
entries: {@i The Crab Cycle: there is only one step and it is crab.}

As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can cast {@spell True Polymorph|XPHB} on yourself into a {@creature Crab|XMM}. When you do so, the duration of the spell is Until Dispelled. Once the charm is used, it vanishes from you.
{@note Made by Chrys}

reward.name: Minor Blessing
entries: A god has noticed your prayers or some great deed you've undertaken, and given you their divine blessing.

When you receive this charm, the GM determines which ability is blessed. When you would fail a Skill Check which uses the blessed ability, you may use this charm to increase the result of the roll by 10.
{@note Made by Gavin}

reward.name: Nah, I Can't...
entries: As a Bonus Action, you drop to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}. Once you do so, this Charm disappears from you.
{@note Made by Christopher}

reward.name: What are we gonna do?!?
entries: You can cast {@spell Divination|XPHB} as a {@action Magic|XPHB} Action with this charm. When you do so, you can only ask about how to accomplish a goal or activity within the next 30 minutes. Once you do so, this Charm disappears from you.
{@note Made by Landon}

reward.name: Demon Spawn
entries: For whatever benign reason, you have been transformed into a creature that carries the essence of evil itself. The traits gained from your species are replaced with the following:

items: {@b Creature Type:} Your creature type is Fiend (Demon).
{@b Abyssal Fortitude:} You are Resistant to Cold, Fire, and Lightning Damage.
{@b Alignment:} Your alignment is Chaotic Evil.

{@b Abyssal Corruption:} You gain a randomly determined flaw from the {@table Optional Rule: Abyssal Corruption; Abyssal Corruption|DMG|Abyssal Corruption table}, ignoring rolls of 10. You yearn for the Abyss; while not in the Abyss, you have a -1 to all {@variantrule D20 test|XPHB|D20 tests}.

entries: {@note Made by Chrys}

reward.name: [LOS] Breaker of Silence
entries: You've felled the third Machine, destroyed the Mass Shadow Engine, and returned both light and water to the streets of Perago.
{@note Made by Christopher}

reward.name: [LOS] Colossus Crusher
entries: You carry the renown of stopping the second Machine's rampage. The people of the Northern regions will speak of your great deed for many years.
{@note Made by Christopher}

reward.name: [LOS] Starmantle's Gratitude
entries: You've extinguished the inferno and felled the first Machine. As such, you have the deepest thanks of Starmantle's people.
{@note Made by Christopher}

reward.name: Saved Up Enough To Finally Go to Wildspace
entries: If you have 10,000 gp, you can spend that much gp and a Bastion Turn to take a vacation to Wildspace. You receive a {@item Fish Suit|AAG} as a souvenir and this Story Record is replaced with {@reward Bought a Trip to Wildspace|WM4}.
{@note Made by Landon}

reward.name: Bought a Trip to Wildspace
entries: You bought a trip to Wildspace! Nice.
{@note Made by Landon}

reward.name: [SEC] Dungeoneer
entries: You have become an official member of the Scholar Exploration Corps and are able to go on expeditions with them.

Whenever you take the Guildhall: Dungeoneer bastion turn, you can choose to go on an expedition with SEC. If you do so, roll on the list twice and pick one of the items you rolled to receive (Rerolling duplicates).
{@note Made by Gem}
